sect2.title: ATLAS (Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software).
sect2.para: On most Linuxes this package is available as pre-compiled binary under the name atlas. You also need atlas-devel to include some required header files. Atlas usually comes with Blas (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) and Lapack (Linear Algebra PACKage).
On Fedora: yum install atlas atlas-devel
About Blas: http://www.netlib.org/blas/
About Lapack: http://www.netlib.org/lapack/
About Atlas: http://math-atlas.sourceforge.net/

sect2.title: libxml2
sect2.para: The XML C parser and toolkit. Required for XML file reading and writing.
Usually available as rpm or pre-compiled binaries.
About libxml2: http://xmlsoft.org/

sect2.title: Boost
sect2.para: Boost provides a lot of useful C++ binaries, especially Ublas, a C++ template class library that provides BLAS level 1, 2, 3 functionality for dense, packed and sparse matrices.
Ublas is used in Siconos for matrices and vectors definition and implementation.
Install:

listitem.para: Download bjam. The recommended way to get Boost.Jam if you are using a Boost distribution is to download a pre-built executable from http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=7586&package_id=72941.
Type in the Boost directory: /the/path/of/BOOST-JAM/bjam install (as root)

sect2.para: About Boost: http://www.boost.org/
About Ublas: http://www.boost.org/libs/numeric/ublas/doc/index.htm

sect2.title: cppunit
sect2.para: CppUnit is a C++ unit testing framework, necessary in Siconos in you want to run tests (make check).
About cppunit: http://cppunit.sourceforge.net/

sect2.title: Scilab
sect2.para: Scilab is an open source platform for numerical computation, used in Front-End package.
Download : http://www.scilab.org/download/index_download.php?page=releasecandidate.html About scilab: http://www.scilab.org/en/

sect2.title: Python
sect2.para: Python® is a dynamic object-oriented programming language, used in Front-End package.
About Python; http://www.python.org/
The Numeric package for Python is available on Gforge, https://gforge.inria.fr/frs/?group_id=9.
You also need Swig, a software development tool that connects programs written in C and C++ with Python.
About swig: http://www.swig.org/

sect2.title: Doxygen
sect2.para: Doxygen is a documentation system for C++, C, Java, Objective-C, Python, IDL (Corba and Microsoft flavors) and to some extent PHP, C#, and D. It is used to generate documentation for Siconos files.
You may also need qt, graphviz ... See http://www.stack.nl/~dimitri/doxygen/install.html for details.

sect1.title: Platforms
sect1.para: Siconos v1.3.0 has been successfully compiled on Linux Fedora Core 4 (gcc4.x)

listitem.para: Mac OS X: the compilation has not been fully tested and may failed ...
Windows: not available at the time, but we would be really grateful for any contribution!

sect1.para: If you have compiled Siconos on another platform successfully, then the maintainer would be glad to hear about that.
